Asset verification not required for MI SNAP under BBCE
MI SNAP: not applicable under BBCE. Medicaid Non-MAGI: standard SSI-methodology resource limits apply.
MI SNAP: always true under BBCE; no resource test
MI SNAP uses 200% FPL gross income threshold under BBCE versus federal 130% gross / 100% net
MI SNAP: 200% FPL gross income test only under BBCE; no net income test
BBCE removes categorical ineligibility for lottery/gambling winnings in MI SNAP

County-specific ABAWD time-limit waivers available in qualifying areas; Michigan has historically obtained statewide or partial waivers
Healthy Michigan Plan covers lawfully present immigrants after 5-year bar. MIChild covers lawfully present children. SDA requires lawful presence.
HMP: 138% FPL adults 19-64. Pregnant women: 195% FPL. MIChild: children in families 200-217% FPL. SSI auto-enrollment (1634 state).
MI is a 1634 state: SSI recipients receive automatic Medicaid enrollment
Medicaid Buy-In for workers with disabilities: working disabled buy-in program, MI implementation
Must demonstrate current employment for Medicaid Buy-In eligibility
Healthy Michigan Plan incentive: completing a health risk assessment reduces copay obligations. Boolean indicates whether the enrollee has completed the healthy behaviors requirement.
MI uses federal 60-month look-back for asset transfers. Standard Medicaid non-MAGI estate recovery applies.
48-month state time limit (shorter than 60-month federal lifetime limit). FIP is Michigan's TANF program.
FIP good cause exemption includes domestic violence per Family Violence Option
FIP sanction tracking: escalating sanctions for non-compliance with work requirements or other program rules. First sanction reduces grant 25%; subsequent sanctions increase.
Michigan LIHEAP uses 150% FPL or 110% state median income as income threshold; administered by MDHHS with primary focus on winter heating assistance
SUA linkage: Michigan LIHEAP benefit confers SNAP Standard Utility Allowance (SUA) eligibility. Primarily winter heating focus; administered by MDHHS.
Michigan SSI state supplement amount; MI is a 1634 state with a small state supplement. SSA administers federal SSI; state supplement is state-funded.
Cash assistance for disabled adults not eligible for SSI; approximately $200/month. State-funded; administered by MDHHS.
Crisis payments for heat, utilities, housing, and burial. State-funded emergency assistance; administered by MDHHS.
Subsidized child care for working families. Supports low-income parents in maintaining employment through child care subsidies.
Required for all state-only programs; SDA requires disability determination (age relevant)
Required for all state-only programs
Must meet disability criteria for SDA eligibility; must be disabled and not eligible for SSI
Employment status required for CDC; parents must be employed or in approved activity to receive child care subsidy
Income type required for all state-only programs
Income verification required for all state-only programs
Michigan 83 counties each administer benefits; county code identifies administering MDHHS office. Bridges eligibility system uses county code for case assignment.
Bridges/MiBridges case tracking number. Michigan uses the Bridges eligibility system for all MDHHS-administered programs; MiBridges is the online self-service portal.
Verification of Michigan residency required for all state-administered programs
Bridges eligibility system client identifier; used across all MDHHS-administered programs
